30.context: CinematicNodeContext: Big sound of explosion. Reuse any shots of party looking up at burning city that we can. (It's burning from previous attacks by nautiloids and dragons, not from Gale's explosion.)InternalNodeContext: This picks up from END_BrainBattle_GaleExplosion where Gale blows himself up on top of the brain after having teleported the party to safety.

24.speaker: Lae'zel
24.text: He succeeded. He destroyed the Netherbrain.

4.speaker: Lae'zel
4.text: ...The parasite. It's withered, dead along with the Netherbrain. I am cleansed! I will never be a filthy ghaik.

14.speaker: Lae'zel
14.text: He sacrificed his life for everyone. He may not have been a warrior, but he fought better than any of us.

12.speaker: Orpheus
12.text: Even when my time in the Prism stretched out like eternity - when escape seemed impossible - I never lost hope.

13.speaker: Orpheus
13.text: I will ensure that all githyanki know his name - and his sacrifice. What he has done today will start a fire that rages across the Astral Plane.

50.speaker: Orpheus
50.text: With their lost Prince returned, my people will burn away Vlaakith's corruption. And it is all thanks to Gale - the wizard who destroyed a Netherbrain.

45.speaker: The Emperor
45.text: It seems that your sacrifice was not needed. Nonetheless, I hope you enjoy your newly uncovered potential.

38.speaker: The Emperor
38.text: We have achieved all that I desired. Thanks to Gale, we are free.

53.speaker: Shadowheart
53.text: All that wisdom, lost, forever. All so that we could survive. I owe him my life. We all do.

20.speaker: Astarion
20.text: Strange... I miss him. More than I thought I would.

6.speaker: Wyll
6.text: The city must remember him. Not just for his triumph, but for his courage.

55.speaker: Karlach
55.text: He's a hero. A fucking hero.

11.speaker: Halsin
11.text: May he find the rest he deserves. Such an act will be remembered. And in its memory, he will live on.

7.speaker: Jaheira
7.text: Gale was many things - but he was a hero, at the very end. That is how he ought to be remembered.

8.speaker: Minsc
8.text: Boo will raise a statue in Gale's name. It will be the size of a planet to honour the size of Gale's courage.

25.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
25.text: He recognised he was the least of us, and spent his life to ensure our survival. That showed wisdom.

36.speaker: Karlach
36.text: But we'll never forget him. And neither will the city he saved.

34.speaker: Astarion
34.text: Of course, it did cost us a wizard. But - well, it was his choice.

48.speaker: Astarion
48.text: Of course, it did cost us a wizard. Poor Gale.

22.speaker: Wyll
22.text: But Gale... I can't believe he's gone.

28.speaker: Karlach
28.text: Gale gave his life for us, for everyone... and now he's gone.

10.speaker: Halsin
10.text: We prevailed, but only thanks to Gale.

44.speaker: Jaheira
44.text: The wizard didn't live to see himself cured. He gave his life for everyone else.

17.speaker: Minsc
17.text: Boo will be sad for Gale. He was the best wizard Boo ever knew. The only wizard close to Boo's power.

57.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
57.text: All it cost was a single wizard.

60.speaker: Karlach
60.text: And all it cost was our friend.

40.speaker: Shadowheart
40.text: I can't feel the tadpole... they must have all died in the explosion - that means I can't turn into a mind flayer!

2.speaker: Astarion
2.text: The tadpole - I can't feel it anymore. And here I was worried I'd become some grotesque, deformed beast.

54.speaker: Astarion
54.text: The tadpole - I can't feel it anymore. Thanks to that bomb of his, we're not going to turn into mind flayers!

19.speaker: Wyll
19.text: I can't feel the tadpole. By the Triad, we're cleansed - we will never be mind flayers!

37.speaker: Halsin
37.text: The tadpoles must have died with the brain in the explosion. The threat of ceremorphosis is no more.

1.speaker: Jaheira
1.text: And the tadpoles have fallen silent, I take it? Good.

42.speaker: Minsc
42.text: And the worm squirms no more! Boo need not worry that his seat on my skull will grow suddenly stickier with mind flayer juice.

33.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
33.text: And we are cleansed. The tadpoles are still, at last.

51.speaker: Shadowheart
51.text: He did it, he actually did it... he blew up the brain.

43.speaker: Astarion
43.text: The wizard did it... he really did it. He blew up the brain.

31.speaker: Wyll
31.text: Gale... he did it, he really did it. The Netherbrain is defeated.

18.speaker: Karlach
18.text: He did it... he actually did it... he blew up the Netherbrain.

0.speaker: Halsin
0.text: He succeeded. The Netherbrain is defeated.

27.speaker: Jaheira
27.text: That wizard took a risk, and it looks like it paid off. The brain is destroyed.

39.speaker: Minsc
39.text: Boo wants to reassure you that the boom was not him. It was the sound of Gale blowing up the brain.

58.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
58.text: It seems the wizard kept his nerve. He destroyed the brain.

59.speaker: Narrator
59.text: *The brain is gone, and with it, the legions of tadpoles that it spawned. There will be no Grand Design, no domination, no enslaving of the land.*

29.speaker: Narrator
29.text: *And it's all thanks to Gale, the wizard who saved Baldur's Gate.*
